caption: Fra Angelico’s Annunciation (mid-1430s)
description: Fra Angelico's serene depiction of the angel Gabriel announcing to Mary that she will bear the Son of God, emphasizing purity and divine grace.
subject: The Annunciation of the Virgin Mary
title: The Annunciation

caption: Rembrandt's The Visitation
description: Rembrandt's dramatic portrayal of Mary visiting her cousin Elizabeth, highlighting the emotional connection between the two women.
location: Detroit Institute of Arts, Michigan, USA
subject: Mary visiting Elizabeth
title: The Visitation

caption: Giovanni Antonio Pellegrini's The Nativity
description: Pellegrini's vibrant Nativity scene captures the holy moment of Christ's birth with rich colors and dynamic composition.
subject: The birth of Jesus Christ
title: The Nativity

caption: Fresco of Presentation in the Temple in Chiesa di Santa Rita by Giulio Campi (1547)
description: Campi's fresco depicts the biblical scene of Mary and Joseph presenting the infant Jesus to the priest Simeon in the Temple.
location: Chiesa di Santa Rita, Cremona, Italy
subject: Presentation of Jesus in the Temple
title: The Presentation in the Temple

caption: Finding of Jesus in the Temple mosaic from Lourdes Basilica, France
description: A mosaic illustrating the moment Mary and Joseph find the young Jesus teaching among the elders in the Temple.
subject: Jesus found teaching in the Temple
title: The Finding of Jesus in the Temple

caption: An unknown artist’s fresco, Baptism of Christ, in Padua’s church of San Benedetto
description: A fresco depicting John the Baptist baptizing Jesus in the Jordan River, symbolizing the beginning of Christ's ministry.
location: Church of San Benedetto, Padua, Italy
mystery_name: The Baptism of Jesus in the Jordan
subject: Baptism of Jesus by John the Baptist
title: The Baptism of Christ

caption: Carl Bloch’s The Wedding at Cana
description: Bloch's painting illustrates Jesus performing his first miracle by transforming water into wine at a wedding feast.
subject: Jesus turning water into wine
title: The Wedding at Cana

caption: James Tissot’s Healing of the Lepers at Capernaum
description: Tissot's detailed depiction of Jesus compassionately healing lepers, emphasizing his divine power and mercy.
mystery_name: The Proclamation of the Kingdom of God
subject: Jesus healing lepers
title: Healing of the Lepers at Capernaum

caption: Transfiguration in Vienna’s Votive Church
description: A depiction of Jesus transfigured on the mountain, revealing his divine glory to Peter, James, and John.
subject: Transfiguration of Jesus
title: The Transfiguration

caption: Giacomo Raffaelli (1753-1836) , an Italian mosaicist, created a life-sized mosaic copy of Leonardo da Vinci's The Last Supper
description: Raffaelli's mosaic recreates Leonardo da Vinci's iconic Last Supper, faithfully capturing the dramatic moment of Jesus announcing his betrayal.
subject: The Last Supper of Jesus with his disciples
title: The Last Supper

caption: Agony in the Garden by Vicente Masip, also known as Vicente Juan Masip
description: Depicts Jesus praying in Gethsemane, surrounded by sleeping apostles, before His arrest.
subject: Christ's agony in the garden
title: Agony in the Garden

caption: Giovanni Antonio Bazzi known as Sodoma, Christ at the Column (c. 1510-1515; detached fresco, 140 x 101 cm; Siena, Pinacoteca Nazionale)
description: Shows Christ tied to a column, enduring the scourging before His crucifixion.
subject: Christ being scourged at the pillar
title: Christ at the Column

caption: Titian’s Christ Crowned with Thorns (c. 1542–1543)
description: Depicts the moment when soldiers place a crown of thorns on Jesus' head.
subject: Christ being mocked and crowned with thorns
title: Christ Crowned with Thorns

caption: Pieter Bruegel the Elder’s The Procession to Calvary (1564)
description: A crowded scene showing Jesus carrying His cross amidst a bustling crowd.
subject: Christ carrying the cross to Calvary
title: The Procession to Calvary

caption: The fresco of Crucifixion in the church San Girolamo dei Croati by Pietro Gagliardi (1847-1852)
description: Depicts the final moments of Jesus' earthly life on the cross.
location: Chiesa di San Girolamo dei Croati, Rome, Italy
subject: Christ crucified between two thieves
title: Crucifixion

caption: Resurrection (1593) by Annibale Carracci
description: Shows Christ triumphant over death, emerging from the tomb.
subject: Christ rising from the dead
title: Resurrection

caption: Crossing (Ascension) cupola 1175-1200 Mosaic Basilica di San Marco (Cupola of St. Mark), Venice
description: Depicts Jesus rising to heaven, witnessed by His disciples.
location: Basilica di San Marco, Venice, Italy
subject: Christ ascending into heaven
title: Ascension

caption: “Pentecost” by Jean Restout II (1692–1768)
description: Shows the Holy Spirit descending as tongues of fire on Mary and the apostles.
mystery_name: The Descent of the Holy Spirit
subject: Descent of the Holy Spirit upon the apostles
title: Pentecost

caption: The Assumption of Virgin Mary in the main cupola in Chiesa di Santa Maria del Orto by Giuseppe and Andrea Orazi 1706
description: Depicts Mary being taken body and soul into heavenly glory.
location: Chiesa di Santa Maria del Orto, Rome, Italy
subject: Virgin Mary ascending to heaven
title: The Assumption of Virgin Mary

caption: Coronation of the Virgin, a painting on oil on canvas by Diego Velázquez of the Holy Trinity crowning the Blessed Virgin Mary, at the Museo del Prado
description: Depicts the Holy Trinity crowning Mary as Queen of Heaven.
subject: Mary being crowned Queen of Heaven
title: Coronation of the Virgin

caption: The Annunciation, an 1898 painting by African-American painter Henry Ossawa Tanner
description: A modern depiction of the Annunciation with Mary receiving the angel Gabriel, showcasing light and simplicity.
subject: Annunciation
title: The Annunciation

caption: The painting of Visitation in the church Chiesa dei Santi Severino e Sossio by Federico Maldarelli (1889)
description: Depicts Mary visiting Elizabeth, emphasizing their holy encounter with expressive and traditional elements.
location: Chiesa dei Santi Severino e Sossio, Naples
subject: Visitation of Mary to Elizabeth
title: Visitation

caption: Gerard van Honthorst - Adoration of the Shepherds (1622)
description: A luminous portrayal of shepherds adoring the Christ Child, infused with Baroque dynamism and chiaroscuro.
subject: Nativity scene with shepherds
title: Adoration of the Shepherds

caption: The painting of Presentation of Jesus in the Temple in church kostel Svatého Havla by unknown baroque artist
description: A dramatic Baroque depiction of Jesus being presented in the temple, highlighting piety and prophecy.
subject: Presentation of Jesus
title: Presentation of Jesus in the Temple

caption: Jesus, at 12, teaching in the Temple
description: Depicts the young Jesus engaging with temple scholars, illustrating wisdom and divine insight.
subject: Jesus teaching scholars
title: Jesus Teaching in the Temple

artist: Andrea del Verrocchio and Leonardo da Vinci
caption: The Baptism of Christ by Leonardo Da Vinci created in the studio of Andrea del Verrochio around 1475
description: Collaborative work depicting John the Baptist baptizing Jesus, blending delicate details and divine presence.
mystery_name: The Baptism of Jesus in the Jordan
subject: Baptism of Jesus
title: The Baptism of Christ

caption: Gerard David's The Marriage at Cana
description: A serene depiction of Christ performing his first miracle, filled with symbolic gestures and rich details.
subject: Wedding at Cana
title: The Marriage at Cana

caption: The Adulterous Woman by Lorenzo Lotto
description: Portrays Christ’s mercy toward the accused woman, emphasizing forgiveness and moral judgment.
subject: Christ and the adulterous woman
title: The Adulterous Woman

caption: Raphael's The Transfiguration
description: Dramatically captures Christ’s divine transfiguration, blending heavenly light and earthly struggles in one masterpiece.
subject: Transfiguration of Christ
title: The Transfiguration

caption: The Last Supper by Juan de Juanes
description: A Spanish Renaissance depiction of the Eucharist’s institution, marked by vivid colors and deep religious sentiment.
subject: Last Supper
title: The Last Supper

caption: The Prayer of Jesus in Gethsemane by Alessandro Maganza
description: A depiction of Jesus praying in anguish in the Garden of Gethsemane before His arrest.
subject: Jesus praying in the Garden of Gethsemane
title: The Prayer of Jesus in Gethsemane

caption: The Flagellation of Christ: Painting by Caravaggio
description: A dramatic Baroque portrayal of Christ being scourged, emphasizing suffering and divine sacrifice.
subject: Christ being scourged at the pillar
title: The Flagellation of Christ

caption: Caravaggio's Ecce Homo - Behold The Man
description: A poignant depiction of Christ crowned with thorns, presented to the crowd by Pilate.
subject: Christ presented to the people with the crown of thorns

caption: The Lost Caravaggio - Ecce Homo
description: An alternate lost version of Caravaggio’s Ecce Homo, depicting Jesus humiliated before His crucifixion.

caption: Christ carrying the Cross (1605) by Orazio Gentileschi
description: A Baroque painting showing Jesus struggling under the weight of the cross on His way to Calvary.
subject: Jesus bearing the cross on the Via Dolorosa
title: Christ Carrying the Cross

caption: James Tissot's What Our Lord Saw From The Cross
description: A striking watercolor depicting the crowded scene beneath Christ as He looks down from the cross.

caption: Caravaggio's The Incredulity of St. Thomas
description: A dramatic scene of Thomas touching Christ’s wounds, symbolizing faith through physical proof.
subject: Thomas touching Christ’s wounds after Resurrection
title: The Incredulity of Saint Thomas

caption: Ascension of the Lord by Bernardino Gandino
description: A depiction of Christ rising triumphantly to heaven, witnessed by His disciples below.
subject: Christ ascending into heaven
title: Ascension of the Lord

caption: Pentecost by Titian
description: A vibrant Renaissance depiction of the Holy Spirit descending upon the Apostles and Mary.
mystery_name: The Descent of the Holy Spirit
subject: The descent of the Holy Spirit upon the Apostles
title: Pentecost

caption: Fresco of Assumption of Our Lady in the Vision of St Bonaventure in the church Chiesa di Santa Lucia del Gonfalone by Cesare Mariani (1863)
description: A grand fresco portraying Mary’s bodily ascent to heaven, witnessed by angels and saints.
location: Chiesa di Santa Lucia del Gonfalone, Rome
subject: The Assumption of Mary into heaven
title: Assumption of Our Lady in the Vision of St Bonaventure

caption: Coronation of the Virgin, fresco by Giuseppe Mattia Borgnis
description: Depicts the Virgin Mary being crowned by the Holy Trinity, symbolizing her role as Queen of Heaven.
subject: Coronation of Mary
title: Coronation of the Virgin

caption: Jan van Eyck's The Annunciation portrays the angel Gabriel announcing to Mary, who humbly accepts God's will
description: Depicts the angel Gabriel announcing to Mary that she will bear the Son of God.
location: National Gallery of Art, Washington, D.C.
subject: Annunciation
title: The Annunciation

caption: Basilica of the Visitation in Ein Karem, a village in the hill country of Judea where John the Baptist was born
description: Depicts Mary visiting Elizabeth, greeting her with joy over their miraculous pregnancies.
location: Basilica of the Visitation, Ein Karem
subject: Visitation of Mary to Elizabeth
title: The Visitation

caption: Nativity with St. Francis and St. Lawrence by Caravaggio
description: Depicts the birth of Jesus with St. Francis and St. Lawrence in solemn contemplation.

caption: Simeon's Song of Praise by Arent de Gelder
description: Depicts Simeon praising God upon seeing the infant Jesus in the Temple.

title: Simeon's Song of Praise

caption: Finding of the Savior in the Temple by William Holman Hunt
description: Depicts Mary and Joseph finding Jesus teaching among the elders in the Temple.
subject: Jesus found teaching in the Temple

caption: Apparition of the Messiah, an oil painting on canvas, measuring 540 cm × 750 cm, by Russian painter Alexander Andreyevich Ivanov (1806–1858)
description: Depicts John the Baptist pointing to Jesus as the Messiah before a diverse crowd.

subject: John the Baptist proclaiming Jesus

caption: Wedding at Cana by Paolo Veronese
description: Depicts Jesus performing his first miracle by turning water into wine at a wedding feast.
subject: Wedding at Cana
title: The Wedding at Cana

caption: Christ in the Storm on the Sea of Galilee, a 1633 oil-on-canvas painting by the Dutch Golden Age painter Rembrandt van Rijn
description: Depicts Jesus calming a violent storm while the disciples panic aboard their boat.

subject: Jesus calming the storm

caption: The Savior’s Transfiguration by Theophanes the Greek
description: Depicts Jesus radiating divine light atop Mount Tabor with Moses and Elijah.
subject: Transfiguration of Jesus
title: The Savior’s Transfiguration

caption: Christ and the Disciples Before the Last Supper by Henry Ossawa Tanner
description: A solemn depiction of Christ and His disciples preparing for the Last Supper, emphasizing spiritual contemplation.
location: Greenville County Museum of Art, South Carolina, USA
subject: Christ and His disciples before the Last Supper
title: Christ and the Disciples Before the Last Supper

caption: The Arrest of Christ Kiss of Judas by Giotto
description: A dramatic fresco capturing Judas' betrayal of Christ, highlighting tension and divine resignation.
subject: Judas betraying Christ with a kiss
title: The Arrest of Christ (Kiss of Judas)

caption: The Flagellation of Our Lord Jesus Christ by Bouguereau
description: A poignant depiction of Christ's suffering during His scourging, emphasizing sacrifice and innocence.
location: Musée des Beaux-Arts, La Rochelle, France

caption: Van Dyck's _The Crowning with Thorns_ (early 17th century), a Baroque depiction of Christ's suffering and paradoxical triumph
description: A dramatic Baroque portrayal of Christ's humiliation crowned with thorns, juxtaposing suffering and majesty.
subject: Christ being mocked with a crown of thorns
title: The Crowning with Thorns

caption: Raphael's Christ Falls on the Way to Calvary, a painting depicting Christ stumbling under the cross with Mary and a crowd witnessing
description: A compassionate depiction of Christ falling under the cross, emphasizing human suffering and divine perseverance.

caption: The Descent from the Cross (1616-1617) by Rubens: A dynamic, dramatic depiction of Christ's descent
description: A baroque masterpiece depicting the sorrowful descent of Christ from the cross with dramatic intensity.

caption: The Three Marys at the Tomb by Annibale Carracci, 17th century at Hermitage Museum, reveals Baroque vividness and drama
description: A baroque depiction of the Marys witnessing the empty tomb, conveying awe and the promise of resurrection.
subject: The Marys discovering Christ's empty tomb
title: The Three Marys at the Tomb

caption: Christ Taking Leave of the Apostles by Duccio, 14th century, Museo dell'Opera, tempera on wood, Gothic details
description: A gothic masterpiece showing Christ bidding farewell to His apostles, highlighting divine mission and sorrow.
location: Museo dell'Opera del Duomo, Siena, Italy
subject: Christ appearing to His apostles before His ascension
title: Christ Taking Leave of the Apostles

caption: Simone Peterzano's Pentecost depicts the Virgin and disciples receiving the Holy Spirit in Mannerist style
description: A mannerist portrayal of Pentecost, capturing divine light and spiritual fervor among the disciples.

caption: The Divine Exchange Between Mother and Son
description: A stained-glass window illustrating Mary's assumption into heaven, symbolizing divine honor and heavenly glory.
subject: The Assumption of the Virgin Mary into heaven

caption: Mary, Help of Christians by Giuseppe Rollini
description: A fresco depicting Mary, Help of Christians, showcasing her protective and intercessory role over believers.
